POEMS IN ENGLISH - #
Richard Eberhart
"FOR A LAMB”
I aav on the slant hill a putrid lamb.
Propped with daisies. The sleep looked deep,
The face nudged in the green pillow
But the guts were out for the crows to eat.
Where *8 the lamb? whose tender plaint
Said all for the mute breezes.
Say he’s in the wind somewhere.
Say, therms a lamb in the daisies.
I. A BRIEF PARAPHRASE
Uhe poet, seeing a dead lamb on a flower-covered hillside, reflects upon
its death and suggests that the vitality of the lamb—so evident a few days
past—has become part of the wind or the flowers.
